intro: Otophylla densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered otophylla, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a finely toothed margin, and the stems are usually hairy. Otophylla densiflora is often found in temperate regions of the northern hemisphere.
